docs.snippet: In a demonstration Wednesday, two Major League Baseball officials played the roles of an umpire in Manhattan and an umpire calling from Arizona to report a manager’s challenge to a play....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a demonstration Wednesday, two Major League Baseball officials played the roles of an umpire in Manhattan and an umpire calling from Arizona to report a manager’s challenge to a play.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball offers demonstration of its new instant replay review system, which links camera feeds from 30 ballparks to replay operations center at MLB Advanced Media in Manhattan; in demonstration, two MLB officials play the roles of an umpire at the operations center and an umpire calling in from Arizona to report a manager’s challenge to a play.

headline.main: From Field to Video Room: How Baseball’s Replay Review Will Work
headline.print_headline: Giving Umpires the Best Angles on Challenges

docs.snippet: Major League Baseball and the Players Association are working toward an agreement that would again increase penalties for the use of performance-enhancing substances....
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Baseball and the Players Association are working toward an agreement that would again increase penalties for the use of performance-enhancing substances.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball and its Players Association are working toward agreement that will again increase penalties for use of performance-enhancing substances; are considering increasing penalties to 80-game ban for first offense and 162 games for a second.

headline.main: M.L.B. and Players Union Close In on Tougher Drug Penalties
headline.print_headline: M.L.B. and Players Union Close In on Tougher Penalties for Drug Use

docs.snippet: The exchange of gifts is a de rigueur part of every papal audience but Thursday's presentation had an unusually loud element to it. A metal support holding up the top of President Barack Obama's gift — a chest of seeds from the White House g...
docs.lead_paragraph: The exchange of gifts is a de rigueur part of every papal audience but Thursday's presentation had an unusually loud element to it. A metal support holding up the top of President Barack Obama's gift — a chest of seeds from the White House garden — twice crashed onto the marble floor of the pope's library as reporters and photographers rushed to get into position to record the moment for posterity.

headline.main: WHITE HOUSE NOTEBOOK: Obama Meets Your Holiness
headline.print_headline: WHITE HOUSE NOTEBOOK: Obama Meets Your Holiness
